leaflet.constituency: Peterborough and Peakirk, Eye, Thorney & Newborough

messages.title: Why local residents in Peterborough are backing Stewart Jackson
messages.content: Stewart Jackson has been elected as the MP for Peterborough since 2005, when he won the seat from Labour. He's been the MP for the past twelve years.

issues.education: Improving local education quality in Peterborough.

housing.content: Stewart has supported tens of thousands of residents with local and national problems relating to housing, education, immigration, health and City Council services.

leaflet.personalStatement: Stewart Jackson - A hardworking local MP for all the residents of Peterborough.

politicalExperience.achievements: Won the seat from Labour, has been the MP for the past twelve years.

endorsements.endorsement: I've raised a number of issues with Stewart over the years and he has always replied promptly to my letters and raised them with the relevant authorities. He's been a great constituency MP for people who've needed help and I'll be voting for him!

Stewart was fundamental in stopping plans to desecrate the Eye, Thorney & Newborough ward with an energy park over local farmers' fields. The area would have been blighted if Stewart had not intervened.

I was a local UKIP candidate last year but I've always been impressed with Stewart's stance on the EU and his work at improving local education quality in Peterborough. I'm backing him wholeheartedly.

images.caption: Stewart Jackson celebrating with a mascot.
